document.masterDocTitle: Water beetles from the Bokkeveld Plateau: a semi-arid hotspot of freshwater biodiversity in the Northern Cape of South Africa

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Water beetles from the Bokkeveld Plateau: a semi-arid hotspot of freshwater biodiversity in the Northern Cape of South Africa

subSubSection.paragraph:
*
Nucleotops interceps Perkins, 2004

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Described from the
Western Cape Province
. Sites 2, 4 & 8.

bibRefCitation.author: Bilton
bibRefCitation.refString: Bilton, D. T. (2013) Crenitis bicolor sp. n. from the Kamiesberg of South Africa (Coleoptera: Hydrophilidae). Zootaxa, 3626 (4), 589 - 592.

subSubSection.paragraph: One of the largest hydraenids on earth, known from the Western and Northern Cape provinces. Sites 1, 12 & 13.

bibRefCitation.author: Perkins
bibRefCitation.refString: Perkins, P. D. (2008) New species and new collection records of Prosthetopine water beetles from southern Africa (Coleoptera: Hydraenidae). Zootaxa, 1864, 1 - 124.

subSubSection.paragraph:
*
Mesoceration foggoi Bilton, 2015
Described from the nearby Gifberg-Matsikammaberg massif. Sites 12–14
Described from the Hantamsberg, but clearly more widespread in the Bokkeveld. Sites 11–13.

*
Mesoceration longipennis Perkins, 2008

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Described from close to the Gifberg in the
Western Cape
. Common in Sites 10, 11 & 12.

*
Mesoceration rufescens Perkins & Balfour-Browne, 1994 Described
from the
Western Cape Province
. Site 12.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Mesoceration
cf. semicarinulum Perkins, 2008
A member of the barriotum group, most likely this species. Sites 5–7.

bibRefCitation.author: Perkins
bibRefCitation.refString: Perkins, P. D. (2008) New species and new collection records of Prosthetopine water beetles from southern Africa (Coleoptera: Hydraenidae). Zootaxa, 1864, 1 - 124.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Described from the nearby Gifberg-Matsikammaberg and adjacent areas in the
Western Cape
( Bilton 2015a ). Sites 1 & 12.

subSubSection.paragraph:
*
Parasthetops benefossus Perkins, 2008

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Described from widely separated localities in the
Western Cape Province
, this species was abundant where found on the Bokkeveld. Sites 5, 6 & 12.

bibRefCitation.author: Perkins
bibRefCitation.refString: Perkins, P. D. & Balfour-Browne, J. (1994). A contribution to the taxonomy of aquatic and humicolous beetles of the family Hydraenidae in southern Africa. Fieldiana Zoology, 77, 1 - 159.

subSubSection.paragraph: A relatively widespread South African endemic. Sites 1 & 3.

*
Parasthetops nigritus Perkins & Balfour-Browne, 1994

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Widespread in the
Western Cape Province
. Sites 2 & 4.

bibRefCitation.author: Perkins
bibRefCitation.refString: Perkins, P. D. (2008) New species and new collection records of Prosthetopine water beetles from southern Africa (Coleoptera: Hydraenidae). Zootaxa, 1864, 1 - 124.

subSubSection.paragraph: Recorded from the Hantamsberg by Bilton (2014a) . Sites 5, 7 & 8.

*
Parasthetops rufulus Perkins & Balfour-Browne, 1994

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Described from the
Western and Eastern Cape
provinces. Site 11.

subSubSection.paragraph:
*
Coelometopon blinkwater Perkins, 2005

paragraph.materialsCitation:
The most common and widespread species of the genus in the
Western Cape
, newly reported here from the
Northern Cape
Province
. Site 9.

subSubSection.paragraph:
*
Hydraena cooperi J. Balfour-Browne, 1954

paragraph.materialsCitation: A widespread southern African species, occurring north to Namibia ( Perkins 2014 ), but not previously reported from the Northern Cape . Sites 1, 4 & 11.

subSubSection.paragraph:
*
Hydraena bicarina Perkins, 2014

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Described from the Gifberg in the
Western Cape
. Sites 1, 7, 12 & 14.

subSubSection.paragraph: Reported from the Hantamsberg by Bilton (2014a) . Sites 4, 5, 6, 11, 12 & 14.
Described from the Hantamsberg, but clearly more widespread on the Bokkeveld. Sites 5, 7 & 8.

*
Parhydraena maureenae Perkins, 2009

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Described from the
Western Cape Province
. Site 5.

bibRefCitation.author: Perkins
bibRefCitation.refString: Perkins, P. D. (2009) Revisions of the genera Parhydraena Orchymont, Protozantaena Perkins, Decarthrocerus Orchymont, and Parhydraenopsis nomen novum, aquatic and humicolous beetles from Africa and Madagascar, and comparative morphology of the tribe Parhydraenini (Coleoptera: Hydraenidae). Zootaxa, 2038, 1 - 119.

subSubSection.paragraph:
*
Pneuminion endroedyi Perkins, 2004

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Described from the
Western Cape
. Site 13.

subSubSection.paragraph: The most abundant and widespread species of the genus in the Cape . Sites 1, 2, 5, 8, 9, 13 & 14.
A widespread Afrotropical species, found throughout South Africa. Sites 1, 4 & 5–7.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Known from the
Western Cape
to Namibia , in saline water. Site 3.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Eastern , Northern and
Western Cape
provinces, in saline waters. Site 3.

bibRefCitation.author: Perkins
bibRefCitation.refString: Perkins, P. D. & Balfour-Browne, J. (1994). A contribution to the taxonomy of aquatic and humicolous beetles of the family Hydraenidae in southern Africa. Fieldiana Zoology, 77, 1 - 159.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Known from the
Eastern Cape
through to Namibia , in saline waters. Site 3.
